questions.question: Digital plan submission is a process whereby:
options: CAD technicians ask for management approval to create technical drawings
GIS technicians have their GIS layers validated against as-built CAD drawings
Land developers submit CAD drawings to local governments to be validated against their standards and loaded into their GIS
Housing developers submit their development project plans to city planning departments for approval

questions.question: Manually reviewing submitted digital plans usually:
options: Ensures a consistent and thorough validation of data regardless of the reviewer
Saves time and money by speeding up the submission process
Leads to costly mistakes and consumes valuable staff time

questions.question: Which of the following is not a step in building a basic digital plan submission workflow using FME?
options: Create a set of standards for validating submitted plans
Build an FME workspace that validates attributes and geometry
Create a self-serve digital plan submission web application using FME Server
Hiring more GIS technicians to manually check the results of the digital plan submission workflow
Testing the digital plan submission workflow
